main event: A fireball or unidentified object was reported streaking across the sky over several western states, including Colorado, Utah, and South Dakota, on October 10, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, bluish-green fireball that left a trail of orange sparks and appeared to be the size of a car.
The object was sighted by numerous witnesses, including pilots, air traffic controllers, and civilians on the ground.
There was speculation that the object could have been a meteor, a satellite, or even a malfunctioning missile or rocket.
The Air Force and North American Air Defense Command investigated the sightings but were unable to definitively identify the object.
Some reports suggested the object may have crashed near the Utah-Colorado border, but no debris was found.
sighted object: bright, bluish-green fireball with an orange trail
location: several western states, including Colorado, Utah, and South Dakota
witnesses: pilots, air traffic controllers, and civilians on the ground
